docs.snippet: French outdoor advertising company JCDecaux is planning to reduce investments in Britain following the country's vote to leave the European Union, its co-chief executive said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: French outdoor advertising company JCDecaux is planning to reduce investments in Britain following the country's vote to leave the European Union, its co-chief executive said on Thursday.

headline.main: JCDecaux to Cut UK Investments After Brexit Vote
headline.print_headline: JCDecaux to Cut UK Investments After Brexit Vote

docs.snippet: Deutsche Boerse said it was on course to reach its 2016 earnings target after net revenue rose 10 percent in the second quarter, helped by higher derivatives trading linked to Britain's vote to leave the European Union....
docs.lead_paragraph: Deutsche Boerse said it was on course to reach its 2016 earnings target after net revenue rose 10 percent in the second quarter, helped by higher derivatives trading linked to Britain's vote to leave the European Union.

headline.main: Brexit-Linked Derivatives Trade Boosts Deutsche Boerse Revenue
headline.print_headline: Brexit-Linked Derivatives Trade Boosts Deutsche Boerse Revenue

docs.snippet: Santander's profit was slightly above forecasts in the second quarter, despite falling 50 percent year-on-year, and the euro zone's biggest bank's shares rose on Wednesday on lower provisions for bad loans and an improvement in Brazil....
docs.lead_paragraph: Santander's profit was slightly above forecasts in the second quarter, despite falling 50 percent year-on-year, and the euro zone's biggest bank's shares rose on Wednesday on lower provisions for bad loans and an improvement in Brazil.

headline.main: Santander's Brazilian Bounce Offsets Profit Hit From One-Offs, Brexit
headline.print_headline: Santander's Brazilian Bounce Offsets Profit Hit From One-Offs, Brexit

docs.snippet: Britain's Arbuthnot Banking Group and its minority-owned Secure Trust Bank Plc expect the market turmoil after the UK's vote to leave the EU to create investment opportunities for their companies, top company executives said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's Arbuthnot Banking Group and its minority-owned Secure Trust Bank Plc expect the market turmoil after the UK's vote to leave the EU to create investment opportunities for their companies, top company executives said.

headline.main: Arbuthnot, Secure Trust See Bright Spots After Brexit Turmoil
headline.print_headline: Arbuthnot, Secure Trust See Bright Spots After Brexit Turmoil

docs.snippet: New Prime Minister Theresa May ruthlessly overhauled the British cabinet on Thursday, sacking a raft of ministers, promoting loyalists and putting supporters of Britain's exit from the European Union firmly in charge of negotiating its terms....
docs.lead_paragraph: New Prime Minister Theresa May ruthlessly overhauled the British cabinet on Thursday, sacking a raft of ministers, promoting loyalists and putting supporters of Britain's exit from the European Union firmly in charge of negotiating its terms.

headline.main: May Builds New-Look Brexit Cabinet to Steer EU Divorce
headline.print_headline: May Builds New-Look Brexit Cabinet to Steer EU Divorce

docs.snippet: SuperGroup, the British company behind the Superdry fashion brand, is well placed to weather sterling's depreciation in the wake of the Brexit vote thanks to its overseas expansion strategy, its boss said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: SuperGroup, the British company behind the Superdry fashion brand, is well placed to weather sterling's depreciation in the wake of the Brexit vote thanks to its overseas expansion strategy, its boss said on Thursday.

headline.main: SuperGroup Says Diversification Means Well Placed to Weather Brexit Fallout
headline.print_headline: SuperGroup Says Diversification Means Well Placed to Weather Brexit Fallout

docs.snippet: U.S Secretary of State John Kerry on Thursday congratulated Boris Johnson on his appointment as Britain's new foreign minister and urged a sensible approach to Britain's exit from the European Union....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S Secretary of State John Kerry on Thursday congratulated Boris Johnson on his appointment as Britain's new foreign minister and urged a sensible approach to Britain's exit from the European Union.

headline.main: Kerry Congratulates UK Foreign Minister Johnson, Urges 'Sensible' Brexit Approach
headline.print_headline: Kerry Congratulates UK Foreign Minister Johnson, Urges 'Sensible' Brexit Approach

docs.snippet: Companies will cut spending on advertising in Britain over the next two years as the country's economic prospects are clouded by uncertainty triggered by the vote to leave the European Union, according to an industry survey on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Companies will cut spending on advertising in Britain over the next two years as the country's economic prospects are clouded by uncertainty triggered by the vote to leave the European Union, according to an industry survey on Thursday.

headline.main: UK Advertising Survey Sees Decline in Adspend Post-Brexit Vote
headline.print_headline: UK Advertising Survey Sees Decline in Adspend Post-Brexit Vote

docs.snippet: Last month's Brexit vote had an immediate impact on Britain's housing market, causing buyer interest and expectations of future sales to wither at the fastest pace in years, a survey showed on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Last month's Brexit vote had an immediate impact on Britain's housing market, causing buyer interest and expectations of future sales to wither at the fastest pace in years, a survey showed on Thursday.

headline.main: Brexit Vote Ravages Sentiment in UK Housing Market-RICS Survey
headline.print_headline: Brexit Vote Ravages Sentiment in UK Housing Market-RICS Survey
